div.h2: How to change the look of the site
div.p: There are several ways to change the look of the site depending on how much you want to change.
Use the 'Manage Site' menu item to change the look and feel of the site.
You create custom HTML pages by authoring well-formed XHTML files and putting them in the viewfile directory.
To view the files you can browse to
You can use the last part: viewfile/your_file_name.xml as menu and navigation URL actions.
HINT: These files are parsed as PHPTAL files which can include php calls into the runtime system when rendering.
Many features of ccMixter are implemented with PHPTAL enhanced xml files.

Currently there is no interactive way to change styles on the site. If you are familiar with XHTML, CSS and basic programming principles you can create a new skeleton skin use that as a basis. The most current instructions for how to create a skin can be found at the ccHost Developer's Wiki.
ccHost can create 'virtual' installations without modifying your server installation. Read more about this feature here.

ul.li: Name This is used in the url. For example: if the tab set is called 'mytabs' and the tab name is 'funky' you can browse to the page and highlight that tab by using ${home-url}view/mytabs/funky
Order The order (from left to right) in which the tabs will appear.
Text This is the text that is used in the tab itself.
Help Hint The text that displays when the user hovers over an unselected tab.

Access This is where (like the menus) you decide who gets to see the items. Contests are a special case that hide certain tabs if they are not relevant, so even if you say the 'Submit Entry' tab is available to 'Everyone', it will be hidden if the contest date has ended.

div.p: The Function and Data fields work together to determin what happens when the user clicks on the tab.

tr.td: A comma separated list of tags. The user will see a listing of uploads that have any of the tags specified.
A comma separated list of tags. The user will see a listing of uploads that have all of the tags specified.

A url to execute. If the url does not start with 'http://' then system will assume it is an internal ccHost URL (e.g. 'viewfile/myhelp.xml' or 'files/submit'). If it does start with 'http://' then the user's browser will be redirected to that web address.
The name of a subnaviation tab set that will appear on the screen under the current tab set. (As of 3/2006 only the top tab set can have a sub-tab set).
